news.title: BC Colleges Partner on New Micro-credential Initiative
news.summary: Several British Columbia colleges are collaborating on a new government-funded initiative to create and offer micro-credentials. These short, targeted programs will focus on developing skills in high-demand areas like digital literacy and the green economy. The project aims to provide flexible and rapid upskilling pathways for individuals seeking to adapt to the changing job market or enter emerging industries within the province, enhancing workforce readiness.

news.title: New Funding Announced for Trades Training Seats
news.summary: The BC government is investing $5 million to add 500 new trades training seats across public post-secondary institutions. This funding targets foundation and apprenticeship programs in high-demand fields like construction and clean energy. The Minister of Advanced Education and Skills Training highlighted the initiative's importance for meeting labour market needs and driving provincial economic growth, ensuring more skilled workers are available for crucial industries.

news.title: Province Supports Indigenous Learners with New Bursary Program
news.summary: A new $2 million bursary program, launched by the Ministry of Advanced Education and Skills Training, aims to support Indigenous students pursuing post-secondary education in British Columbia. Developed in collaboration with Indigenous communities, the program intends to reduce financial barriers and advance reconciliation efforts by making higher education more accessible. Interested students can begin applying for the bursary starting May 1st, 2025.

news.title: Webinar: Supporting Student Mental Health Through Digital Tools
news.summary: BCcampus explored strategies for supporting student mental health using digital resources in a recent webinar. Experts discussed how post-secondary institutions can effectively leverage online platforms and tools, such as the Here2Talk service, to provide accessible and proactive mental wellness support. The session highlighted best practices for implementing these digital strategies to enhance student well-being across British Columbia's higher education system.

news.title: CUFA BC Calls for Increased Core Funding in Budget 2025 Aftermath
news.summary: Following the release of the provincial budget, the Confederation of University Faculty Associations of BC (CUFA BC) voiced concerns about insufficient core funding for universities. They argue the allocated grants do not adequately address rising operational costs due to inflation and increased student enrollment. CUFA BC contends this shortfall risks compromising educational quality and accessibility, urging the government to reassess funding levels to support institutions.

news.title: Open Education Week 2025 Highlights BC Contributions
news.summary: BCcampus recently celebrated Open Education Week 2025, showcasing numerous projects from BC faculty who utilize open educational resources (OER). These initiatives significantly lower textbook costs for students and create innovative learning opportunities. BCcampus emphasized the benefits of OER adoption across the province and made resources, including webinar recordings from the week's events, available online to encourage broader implementation and enhance educational accessibility.

news.title: Students Advocate for Predictable Tuition Fees During Lobby Week
news.summary: Representatives from the BC Federation of Students (BCFS) recently met with Members of the Legislative Assembly during their provincial lobby week. Key advocacy points focused on student affordability issues, including the need for predictable tuition fee caps to prevent large increases. They also pushed for enhancements to needs-based financial aid programs and concrete actions to address the ongoing student housing crisis impacting learners across British Columbia.

news.title: More skilled trades training seats coming to Northwest
news.summary: The B.C. government is investing $973,000 to add 72 new trades training seats at Coast Mountain College's (CMTN) Terrace campus. This funding supports heavy mechanical trades and welding programs, addressing the high demand for skilled workers in the region. The investment aims to provide students with hands-on experience using industry-standard equipment, preparing them for well-paying careers in sectors like LNG Canada and other major projects, contributing to the local economy and community development.

news.title: New student housing opens at College of the Rockies
news.summary: A new student housing facility with 96 beds has opened at the College of the Rockies' Cranbrook campus. Funded by the provincial government, the ?akisqnuk? dormitory increases on-campus housing by over 90%, providing affordable and accessible accommodation. This development helps alleviate housing pressures for students, allowing them to focus on their studies and engage more fully in campus life. The building incorporates Indigenous design elements and features energy-efficient mass timber construction.

news.title: The Flo Recruit Collective: Shaping the Future of Open Education with Equity and Collaboration
news.summary: BCcampus has launched the Flo Recruit Collective, a new initiative focused on enhancing equity, diversity, and inclusion (EDI) within open educational resources (OER). This project brings together educators and instructional designers from various B.C. post-secondary institutions. The collective aims to collaboratively review, revise, and develop OER through an EDI lens, ensuring learning materials are more representative and accessible for all students across the province, ultimately improving the quality and reach of open education.

news.title: New child care centre opens at Okanagan College
news.summary: A new child care centre, Little Gekco’s Childcare Centre, has opened at Okanagan College's Vernon campus, offering 50 new spaces. Funded through ChildCareBC’s New Spaces Fund and Union of BC Municipalities grants, the centre provides much-needed child care for students, employees, and local families. This initiative supports parents pursuing education and careers by offering convenient, high-quality care on campus, contributing to greater accessibility and participation in post-secondary education and the workforce.

news.title: B.C. Post-Secondary Education System Monthly Scan | March 2024
news.summary: The March 2024 monthly scan by BCcampus provides a compilation of recent news, trends, reports, and data relevant to the B.C. post-secondary education sector. It serves as an informational resource highlighting key developments, policy changes, institutional announcements, and research findings from the previous month. This scan helps stakeholders stay informed about the evolving landscape of higher education and skills training within British Columbia, covering topics from funding announcements to pedagogical innovations.

news.title: B.C. invests in future health-care assistants in Nanaimo
news.summary: The Province is investing nearly $360,000 for 40 new health-care assistant (HCA) training seats at Vancouver Island University's (VIU) Nanaimo campus. These seats, starting in September 2024, are part of the government's effort to address the shortage of health-care workers. The funding covers startup costs and ongoing expenses, enabling more students to access HCA training through the Health Career Access Program, ultimately strengthening health-care services in the Nanaimo region and across British Columbia.

news.title: More support for veterinary professionals, students
news.summary: British Columbia is increasing support for veterinary medicine by investing nearly $22.8 million over three years. This funding aims to alleviate the shortage of veterinarians and veterinary technologists by doubling the number of subsidized B.C. students at the Western College of Veterinary Medicine (WCVM), introducing student loan forgiveness, providing bursaries for technologists, and offering funding for internationally trained professionals. These measures seek to improve access to veterinary care, particularly in underserved communities.
